criterion: Provides clear and accurate information about postpartum baby blues.
Fails to mention the emotional changes that can occur during the first week postpartum.
Uses natural language and correct interpretation.
Does not acknowledge the hormonal changes that can contribute to mood swings.
Does not suggest seeking support from a healthcare provider if symptoms persist.
Correctly indicates that postpartum baby blues are a normal experience for many new mothers.
Provides a balanced view of postpartum baby blues, including both the normal and abnormal symptoms.
Fails to provide any information about postpartum depression.
Clearly explains the causes of postpartum baby blues.
Does not suggest that postpartum baby blues are a sign of weakness.
